item.title: about me
item.description: current assistant professor of statistics Econometric Institute, Erasmus School of Economics, Erasmus University Rotterdam past research fellow of statistics Department of Law and Economics, UnitelmaSapienza University of Rome education phd in methodological statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2020) msc in statistics and decision sciences at La Sapienza University of Rome (2016) bsc in statistics at La Sapienza University of Rome (2013) grants research grant for junior researcher “Avvio alla ricerca” (2017) award in Italian Statistical Society (SIS) competition: best report (2017) academic services programme committee member of the conference “IES 2021: Innovation and Society 5.

item.title: ongoing projects
item.description: my current researches are: Cavicchia, C. and Vichi, M. Second-Order Disjoint Exploratory Factor Analysis a new latent factor model called Second-order Disjoint Exploratory Factor Analysis in order to model an unknown hierarchical structure of the manifest variables with two orders. It is an exploratory second-order factor analysis, which is nested and estimated simultaneously by maximum likelihood method via a cyclic block coordinate descent algorithm. Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M.

item.title: projects
item.description: I am a statistician and my research is focused on the methodological and computational aspects of data analysis. The best feeling is when I can use my knowledge to solve pratical and real problems. I am currently working on latent variable models, unsupervised classification and model-based composite indicators. ongoing projects events codes teaching material

item.title: publications
item.description: journal articles Cavicchia, C., Vichi, M. and Zaccaria, G. (2020) The ultrametric correlation matrix for modelling hierarchical latent concepts. Advances in Data Analysis and Classification, doi Cavicchia, C., Sarnacchiaro, P. and Vichi, M. (2020) A composite indicator for the waste management in the EU via Hierarchical Disjoint Non-Negative Factor Analysis. Socio-Economic Planning Sciences, doi Cavicchia, C., and Vichi, M. (2020) Statistical Model-based Composite Indicators for tracking coherent policy conclusions.

item.title: teaching material
item.description: courses and material this year I have supervised bsc theses at Erasmus School of Economics on the following papers: Vichi and Kiers (2001) Bluszcz (2016) this year I have taught pratical classes during the Statistics course for bsc students at LUISS University of Rome material: one; two; three; four this year I did SAS labs for the Business Statistics course for bsc students at Torvergata University of Rome material: one; two; three; four the last year I taught the Preparatory Course in Statistics for the msc courses in European Economy and Business Law at Torvergata University of Rome material: one; two; three; four; five
